article.headline: Alabama State 78, South Alabama 75
article.story: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) -- Akeim Claborn scored 24 points to lead Alabama State to a 78-75 victory over South Alabama on Thursday night. The Hornets' (2-8) win snapped South Alabama's (8-2) seven-game winning streak. "I thought down the stretch their two big guys made some plays and really hurt us," Jaguar head coach John Pelphrey said. "We had our chances, but we just didn't make enough plays." The Jaguars opened the game with an 11-3 start, making five of their first six shots, including three lay-ups by junior Jason McGriff, but a 7-0 Alabama State run cut the deficit to 11-10. The Hornets took their first lead on a Richard Lott layup for a 14-13 score, but South Alabama quickly regained the lead, stretching it to 12 points with 5:47 left in the half. Alabama State fought back to tie the game at 34 after a 12-0 run to end the half. Mario Jointer led the Jaguars with 21 points and had two assists. Chey Christie and Jason McGriff each scored 11 points to round out double-figure scoring for South Alabama. South Alabama was 15-of-32 in the first half for 46.9 percent while Alabama State was 13-of-30 for 43.3 percent.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
